demo.Zhihao.Client

Class ChatClient

  • java.lang.Object
    • demo.Zhihao.Client.ChatClient

  • public class ChatClient
extends java.lang.Object
    The model of the client.
    The design pattern of the client is MVC
    Author:
    ben

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      ChatClient(java.lang.String name, java.lang.String ip, int port)
      Creates a ChatClient by specifying client name, server IP and server TCP port.
      If Exception occurs during this process, stack trace will be printed.
      During this process, client will negotiate client's screen name with server to avoid name conflict.
      When name conflict occurs occurs, a message will be displayed.

      Main method.

      Cuts down the connections and quit.
      Also tells the server.

    • Constructor Detail

      • ChatClient

        public ChatClient(java.lang.String name,
          java.lang.String ip,
          int port)
        Creates a ChatClient by specifying client name, server IP and server TCP port.
        If Exception occurs during this process, stack trace will be printed.
        During this process, client will negotiate client's screen name with server to avoid name conflict.
        When name conflict occurs occurs, a message will be displayed.
        Parameters:
        name - the screen name of the client.
        ip - the IP address of the server.
        port - the given TCP port number of server.
        See Also:
        UIChatRoom.nameConflict(String)

    • Method Detail

      • send

        public void send(java.lang.String msg)
        Sends messages to server.
        Parameters:
        msg - the message to be sent.

      • quit

        public void quit()
        Cuts down the connections and quit.
        Also tells the server.

      • launchDirectConn

        public void launchDirectConn(java.lang.String otherClient)
        Launches UDP direct connection with another client.
        Parameters:
        otherClient - the name of the other client.

      • main

        public static void main(java.lang.String[] args)
        Main method. If parameter is set error, program will exit improperly.
        Parameters:
        args - the arguments should follow the following format:
